entries.title: Record temps send Chicagoans outdoors — and to car wash lines
entries.summary: <p>The temperature hits a record high in February, and where’s your first stop?</p><p>The obvious answer: The car wash.</p><p>People all over Chicago used Monday’s warm weather to turn their cars from salty reminders of winter to shiny and spring-ready vehicles. Then, many took a nice drive with the windows rolled down.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-f10000" name="image-f10000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1d38703/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F76%2F24%2Fde59b0464dd08186637321bd3033%2Fweather-260217-01.JPG 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/737995e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F76%2F24%2Fde59b0464dd08186637321bd3033%2Fweather-260217-01.JPG 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a3fc872/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F76%2F24%2Fde59b0464dd08186637321bd3033%2Fweather-260217-01.JPG" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="A woman runs with her dog in Humboldt Park on Monday. " srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a3fc872/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F76%2F24%2Fde59b0464dd08186637321bd3033%2Fweather-260217-01.JPG 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/fcddc27/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F76%2F24%2Fde59b0464dd08186637321bd3033%2Fweather-260217-01.JPG 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a3fc872/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6122x3436+0+324/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F76%2F24%2Fde59b0464dd08186637321bd3033%2Fweather-260217-01.JPG" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>A woman runs with her dog in Humboldt Park on Monday. The Chicago area set a daily record for Feb. 16, with the high reaching 65 at O’Hare Airport. The previous record high was 58 in 1921.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Anthony Vazquez</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p></p><p>“It’s a vacation day,” Denise Cameron said of the unseasonably warm Presidents Day as she waited for her car at Bert’s Car Wash in West Town. “Everything’s nice — when your car is cleaned and your house is cleaned, everything is good.”</p><p>Another customer — dashing to her freshly detailed car — said she hadn’t gotten it washed since the first snow in the fall.</p><p>The start of this week is giving the city a short reprieve from a snowy and cold winter that saw a 20-day stretch of subfreezing temperatures — the longest in almost two decades — and several snowstorms.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center><div class="Enhancement-item"> <div class="ExternalContent-wrapper" > <div class="TweetUrl"> <blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Spring-like warmth will carry occasional opportunities for showers and even a thunderstorm through the middle of the week. Reality will return toward the end of the week as a cold front delivers more seasonable temperatures (especially by the weekend). <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/ILwx?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#ILwx</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/INwx?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#INwx</a> <a href="https://t.co/3mqylyavvB">pic.twitter.com/3mqylyavvB</a></p>— NWS Chicago (@NWSChicago) <a href="https://twitter.com/NWSChicago/status/2023491551679201402?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 16, 2026</a></blockquote> <script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script> </div> </div> </div></div><p>After a couple sunny and mild days over the weekend, Monday hit a high of 65, making it the warmest Feb. 16 in the city’s recorded history, according to National Weather Service data. The previous record had stood since 1921 at 58 degrees</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-230000" name="image-230000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>A bicyclist rides on Milwaukee Avenue on Monday.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Anthony Vazquez/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>With so many people having the same idea, drivers had to wait in long lines to get their cars cleaned. As many as 19 cars were in line at Bert’s — including two Chicago police vehicles — stretching down the block and around the corner.</p><h3>Perfect winter for car washes</h3><p>Bert’s co-owner Jorge Aguilar said the wait on busy days can last more than an hour. </p><p>“We’ve been busy the last three weeks, nonstop,” Aguilar said. “This year, the wintertime was a little different, right? We haven't seen this winter for many, many years. They got the snow, they got the cold, and then they got warm weather. For us, it was the perfect winter.”</p><p>Aguilar said about 300 cars have been going through Bert’s every day, with 14 or 15 workers on the clock to meet demand.</p><p>Other car washes had lines at least a dozen deep.</p><p>The warm weather and the school holiday brought many outdoors in shorts and short sleeves, grilling and having fun at the lakefront.</p><p>“It's been widespread in the area with temperatures more like mid-April than mid-February,” said Brett Borchardt, a senior meteorologist with the National Weather Service.</p><p>The high of 65 degrees at O’Hare Airport set a record. Borchardt said Peru, Ill., about 100 miles southwest of the city, hit 70 degrees.</p><p>Chicagoans muttered and moaned through cold, wind and snow since October after a series of mild winters the past few years.</p><p>The city exceeded the entire 2024-25 snowfall total by the end of December and has seen 32.1 inches to this point.</p><p>And the 20 days from Jan. 17 to Feb. 6, when temperatures didn’t rise above freezing, made for the longest such stretch in Chicago since 2007.</p><h3>Getting active in Humboldt Park</h3><p>In Humboldt Park on the West Side, Karl Wenzel and Charles Hekma shed their shirts for some tennis, something they haven’t been able to do since the fall.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Charles Hekma and a buddy play tennis for the first time since fall on Monday at Humboldt Park.The winds posed a bit of a challenge.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Anthony Vazquez/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>“It’s windy, which is difficult to play a little bit, but it’s great,” Hekma said. “Got to take advantage, go outside.”</p><p>Wenzel said it was nice to see people getting active.</p><p>“Feels more like a spring day rather than a winter day for sure,” he said. “We’re able to play shirtless in February. That is unusual. I don’t think I’ve ever been able to say that before. I keep forgetting it’s February, actually.”</p><p>Across the street, Gary Times was playing fetch with his two small dogs, Vito and Cupcake.</p><p>“Sweet relief. Finally,” Times said. “I’m tired of the winter.</p><p>“They’ve been cooped up in the house for a little bit,” he said of his dogs. “I don’t really like bringing them out when it’s really cold. So they’ve kind of been whimpering a bit lately since they can’t go outside. But they’ve been having a good time.”</p><p>Nearby, Reynaldo Rodriguez, a local artist, was updating a mural he had painted on a tree trunk in 2021. He took inspiration from Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl halftime show.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" He says he was inspired by Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl halftime performance.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Anthony Vazquez/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>“Too much time inside,” Rodriguez said of the winter.</p><p>Nathan Adams, 7, was climbing a tree stump as his dad Eric looked on. They had biked to the park and planned to go have lunch after.</p><p>“Trying to get him off the screens,” the father said of Nathan. “Just trying to enjoy the park. This park is a great park. aria-label="Next"> <svg class="FlickityCustomNavigation-button-icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-right"></use></svg> </button> </div> </div></div> </bsp-carousel> </div> </div><p>After dipping to 47 degrees Tuesday, the high will be 62 Wednesday, the NWS says. If the weather stays on the warmer side, however, there’s a scenario where Monday through Thursday could all hit the 60s. That would be the warmest few February days since 2017, when temps hit the high 60s and 70s for four days.</p><p>Does this warm stretch indicate the cold and snow are behind us?</p><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div class="RelatedList-title">Related</div> <ul class="RelatedList-items"> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/weather/2025/01/21/arctic-blast-hits-chicago-area-with-dangerously-cold-temps-wind-chills-29-degrees-below-zero" >Arctic blast hits Chicago area with dangerously cold temps, wind chills 29 degrees below zero</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/weather/2025/12/07/temperatures-snow-chicago-weather-forecast-cold" >Chicago records 17.1 inches of snow — the most by Dec. 7 since 1978</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p>“No, we just got locked into a warmer pattern here for a little bit,” National Weather Service meteorologist Zachary Yack said. “Things may change back the other way, who knows? But it doesn’t really give us any indication one way or the other.”</p><p>In fact, real Chicagoans shouldn’t be surprised to learn what could be in store for us by Friday, according to the NWS: Even more snow.</p><p><i>Contributing: Mary Norkol</i></p>
entries.author: Nader Issa

entries.title: Thomas Pritzker resigns from Hyatt Hotels' board citing Epstein emails
entries.summary: <p>Prominent Illinois civic figure <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/2017/10/17/18400266/battle-of-billionaires-pritzker-and-pal-of-rauner-make-forbes-cut" target="_blank" ><u>Thomas Pritzker</u></a> stepped down as executive chairman of Chicago-based Hyatt Hotels Corp., the company announced Monday.</p><p>The news comes months after recently released documents show convicted sex offender <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/washington/2025/11/19/jeffrey-epstein-thomas-pritzker-emails-deeper-ties-jb-pritzker-cousin" target="_blank" ><u>Jeffrey Epstein</u></a> exchanged at least 20 emails with Pritzker, who is Gov. JB Pritzker’s cousin, for years after Epstein's 2008 plea deal on sex crimes charges.</p><p>“My job and responsibility is to provide good stewardship,” Thomas Pritzker said in a news release Monday. “Good stewardship also means protecting Hyatt, particularly in the context of my association with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, which I deeply regret. I exercised terrible judgment in maintaining contact with them, and there is no excuse for failing to distance myself sooner. I condemn the actions and the harm caused by Epstein and Maxwell and I feel deep sorrow for the pain they inflicted on their victims.”</p><p>Pritzker, 75, has not been accused of any wrongdoing, nor has he been named in any investigation into Epstein’s crimes.</p><p>In email exchanges, Pritzker and Epstein remarked on current events and made plans to see each other, according to a review of some of the 20,000 pages of <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/2025/07/17/sen-dick-durbin-requests-immediate-release-epstein-files" target="_blank" ><u>documents</u></a>.</p><p>The emails stretch from at least 2010 — two years after Epstein was convicted of soliciting sex from a child as young as 14 — to early 2019, the year Epstein was arrested on suspicion of child sex trafficking. Epstein killed himself <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/2021/8/26/22643714/troubled-jail-where-jeffrey-epstein-killed-himself-closing" target="_blank" ><u>in jail</u></a><u> in Manhattan</u>, according to the local medical examiner.</p><p>Pritzker informed Hyatt’s board of directors that he has retired as executive chairman, effective immediately, according to a news release Monday. He will not seek re-election to its board of directors at Hyatt’s annual stockholders’ meeting in May.</p><p>He also serves as executive chairman of The Pritzker Organization, an investment firm, and as a member of the board of trustees of the University of Chicago. Neither immediately responded to requests for comment late Monday afternoon.</p><p>Pritzker wrote in a letter to Hyatt’s board that he and his wife, Margot, “are now in a phase of our lives where we are thinking about good stewardship and that includes structuring a proper handoff to the future.”</p><p>He added, “For 70 years, Hyatt has been part of our family’s identity and our family has been part of Hyatt’s identity. Good stewardship is very important to me personally.”</p><p>Pritzker served as a Hyatt board member and as executive chairman since August 2004. Mark Hoplamazian, Hyatt’s president and chief executive, succeeds Pritzker as chairman of the board, effective immediately.</p><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div class="RelatedList-title">Related</div> <ul class="RelatedList-items"> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/columnists/2026/02/08/gerhard-richter-most-expensive-painting-ever-sold-2013-park-hyatt-chicago-lobby" >One of the most expensive paintings by a living artist hung unnoticed in a Downtown hotel lobby</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/obituaries/2025/03/16/cindy-pritzker-obituary-matriarch-illinois-hyatt-architecture-library" >Cindy Pritzker, beloved family matriarch and philanthropist, dies at 101</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p>Hoplamazian said in a news release: “Tom’s decision reflects his stewardship and strong commitment to Hyatt over his many decades of service. Looking ahead, we remain focused on executing our strategy for long-term growth, advancing care for our colleagues, delivering meaningful experiences for our guests, and driving performance for owners and value for our stockholders.”</p><p>Hyatt's portfolio contains more than 1,500 hotels and all-inclusive properties in 83 countries across six continents as of the end of 2025, according to the company.<br></p>

entries.title: Horoscope for Tuesday, February 17, 2026
entries.summary: <h2>Moon Alert</h2> <p>Avoid shopping (except food and gas) and major decisions from 5:45 a.m. to 8:30 a.m. Note: The New Moon peaks today at 6:01 a.m. After that, the moon moves from Aquarius into Pisces.</p><h2>Aries (March 21-April 19)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> We are gregarious creatures. We need to see others, and we also need to be seen. Think about how you can improve your closest friendships today. What kind of friend are you to others? The key to having friends is to be friendly.</p><h2>Taurus (April 20-May 20)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Today's new moon occurs at the top of your chart, offering you a chance to think about your life direction. Where do you want to be one year from now? This is the day to look at your attitude toward authority figures — the police, your boss, parents, and the government.</p><h2>Gemini (May 21-June 20)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> This is the perfect day to take stock of your education and your life experiences. What further education or training might improve your job? What about travel? Do you want to broaden your experience of the world by seeing new places and meeting new people?</p><h2>Cancer (June 21-July 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> The new moon today is the best day all year to think about your shared assets with the government, credit card companies, etc. In other words, what is your debt scene? How independent are you, and how much do you rely on others? (Of course, we all rely on others.)</p><h2>Leo (July 23-Aug. 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Today, the new moon is opposite your sign, prompting you to think about your long-term committed relationships. We often attract people who meet our self-fulfilling prophecies. What do you expect from others? What do others expect from you?</p><h2>Virgo (Aug. 23-Sept. 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Once a year, the new moon urges you to ponder how you can improve your job or how you do your work. It's also the best day to think about what you can do to improve your health. Don't take your body for granted. Cherish it.</p><h2>Libra (Sept. 23-Oct. 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> You appreciate beauty. You're aware of lighting, colors, fragrances, the composition of furniture and spatial relations. Think about how the arts, as well as romance and children, enrich your life.</p><h2>Scorpio (Oct. 23-Nov. 21)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> This is an excellent day to think about your security, your home and your relations with family. These are important issues, and today's new moon is the best day of the year to think about how you can make these relationships mutually supportive.</p><h2>Sagittarius (Nov. 22-Dec. 21)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Today's new moon is an excellent day to think about your style of communicating with others. Do you wait for others to speak first? Are you friendly or suspicious? Talking, reading and listening are food for your soul.</p><h2>Capricorn (Dec. 22-Jan. 19)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> The new moon today occurs in your money house, which means it's your chance to think about your attitude toward money. entries.title: Obama shuts down alien buzz and says there's no evidence they've made contact with earthlings
entries.summary: <p>Former U.S. President Barack Obama said he did not see evidence that aliens “have made contact with us,” after sending social media abuzz by saying aliens were real on a podcast over the weekend.</p><p>During a lightning round of questions with podcast host Brian Tyler Cohen, Obama was asked, “Are aliens real?”</p><p>“They’re real,” he answered, continuing: “But I haven’t seen them. And, they’re not being kept in Area 51.”</p><p>On Sunday, the former president released a statement on Instagram, appearing to clarify what he meant by his comments that have since gone viral.</p><div </div></div><p>“I was trying to stick with the spirit of the speed round, but since it’s gotten attention let me clarify. Statistically, the universe is so vast that the odds are good there’s life out there. But the distances between solar systems are so great that the chances we’ve been visited by aliens is low, and I saw no evidence during my presidency that extraterrestrials have made contact with us. Really!”</p><p>Secrecy around Area 51, a top-secret Cold War test site in the Nevada desert, has long fueled conspiracy theories among UFO enthusiasts.</p><p>In 2013, the CIA acknowledged the existence of the site, but not UFO crashes, black-eyed extraterrestrials or staged moon landings.</p><p>Declassified documents referred to the 8,000-square-mile installation by name after decades of U.S. government officials refusing to acknowledge it.</p><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div class="RelatedList-title">Related</div> <ul class="RelatedList-items"> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/architecture-design/2025/12/08/obama-presidential-center-home-court-building-opened-exclusive-look" >Obama Presidential Center’s first building is complete — Here’s an exclusive look</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/columnists/2019/10/29/20939079/obama-presidential-center-mothership-post-presidency-jackson-park" >The Obama Presidential Center: Obama’s ‘mothership’ for his post-presidency</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p>The base has been a testing ground for a host of top-secret aircraft, including the U2 in the 1950s and later the B-2 stealth bomber.<br></p>
